effects: You always have the spells in the Psionic Spells table prepared at the sorcerer levels shown.
Choose one creature you can see within 30 feet; you and the creature can communicate telepathically while within a number of miles of each other equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1 mile).
You must each know a language the other knows to understand each other.
The connection lasts for a number of minutes equal to your Sorcerer level and ends early if you connect with a different creature.

feature_defs.trigger: when you cast a level 1+ spell from your Psionic Spells feature
effects: You can cast it by expending a spell slot as normal or by spending sorcery points equal to the spells level.
If you cast it using sorcery points, it requires no verbal or somatic components, and no material components unless they are consumed or have a cost.
You have resistance to psychic damage.
You have advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Charmed or Frightened condition.
You can spend 1 or more sorcery points to magically alter your body for 10 minutes.
For each sorcery point you spend, you gain one benefit of your choice until the alteration ends.
Aquatic Adaptation: you gain a swim speed equal to twice your speed, and you can breathe underwater.
Glistening Flight: you gain a fly speed equal to your speed, and you can hover.
See the Invisible: you can see any Invisible creature within 60 feet that isnt behind total cover.
Wormlike Movement: you can move through any space as narrow as 1 inch, and you can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or the Grappled condition.
You teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 120 feet.
Immediately after you disappear, each creature within 30 feet of the space you left must make a Strength save against your spell save DC.
On a failed save, a creature takes 3d10 force damage and is pulled toward the space you left to the nearest unoccupied space; on a success, it takes half damage.
limits: Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest unless you spend 5 sorcery points (no action required) to restore its use.
notes: saving throw DC formula noted in effects
